queries.query: WiFi disconnects after sleep on Windows 11

answer.issue_summary: WiFi disconnects after sleep on Windows 11 laptop
likely_causes: Power saving settings turning off the WiFi adapter
plan_overview: Check quick fixes (power settings, adapter settings)
Consider hardware issues if problems persist

steps.title: Check Power Saving Settings
steps.rationale: Windows may be turning off the WiFi adapter to save power during sleep.
steps.action: Open Device Manager, expand Network adapters, right-click on your WiFi adapter, select Properties, go to the Power Management tab, and uncheck "Allow the computer to turn off this device to save power".
commands: Uncheck 'Allow the computer to turn off this device to save power'
steps.expect: WiFi adapter remains on after sleep.

steps.title: Update WiFi Drivers
steps.rationale: Outdated or corrupted drivers can cause connectivity issues.
steps.action: Open Device Manager, expand Network adapters, right-click on your WiFi adapter, select Update driver, and follow the on-screen instructions.  If updating fails, try uninstalling the driver and restarting your computer to reinstall it.
steps.expect: Updated driver and improved WiFi connectivity

steps.title: Run Network Troubleshooter
steps.rationale: Windows built-in troubleshooter can automatically detect and fix network problems.
steps.action: Open Settings, go to Network & internet, click on Troubleshoot, and run the network troubleshooter.
steps.expect: Troubleshooter identifies and fixes the issue.

steps.title: Check for Conflicting Software
steps.rationale: Other software might interfere with the WiFi adapter.
steps.action: Temporarily disable recently installed software or antivirus programs to see if they are causing the issue.
steps.expect: Improved WiFi connectivity after disabling conflicting software.

steps.title: Check Hardware
steps.rationale: If all software solutions fail, there might be a hardware problem with the WiFi adapter.
steps.action: Consult a professional technician or consider replacing the WiFi adapter.
steps.expect: Hardware issue identified and resolved.

quick_checks: Check if other devices connect to the WiFi network
Check if the WiFi router is working correctly
diagnostics_to_collect: Device Manager details for the WiFi adapter
resolution_criteria: WiFi connects reliably after sleep mode
escalation_criteria: Issue persists after all troubleshooting steps
safety_notes: Always back up your data before making significant system changes
assumptions: User has administrative access to the computer

queries.query: how to connect wifi in phone

answer.issue_summary: Connecting to Wi-Fi on a Windows laptop

steps.title: Quick Checks
steps.rationale: These steps can quickly resolve common issues.
steps.action: Restart your laptop and check if the Wi-Fi connects automatically.  Check if your router is working correctly and other devices can connect.
steps.expect: Wi-Fi connects automatically after restart or router issue is resolved.

steps.title: Verify Wi-Fi Adapter Status
steps.rationale: Ensure the Wi-Fi adapter is enabled and functioning correctly.
steps.action: Open the Network and Sharing Center (search for it in the Start menu). Click on 'Change adapter options'. Check if the Wi-Fi adapter is enabled. If not, right-click and select 'Enable'.
steps.expect: Wi-Fi adapter is enabled and shows as connected.

steps.title: Check Network Settings
steps.rationale: Ensure the correct network is selected and the password is correct.
steps.action: Click the Wi-Fi icon in the system tray. Select your Wi-Fi network and enter the password. If you have previously connected, ensure the network is still saved and the password is correct.
steps.expect: Successful connection to the Wi-Fi network.

steps.title: Update or Reinstall Drivers
steps.rationale: Outdated or corrupted drivers can cause connectivity problems.
steps.action: Open Device Manager (search for it in the Start menu). Expand 'Network adapters'. Right-click on your Wi-Fi adapter and select 'Update driver'. If this fails, try 'Uninstall device' and restart your computer to reinstall the driver automatically.
steps.expect: Driver update or reinstall completes successfully and Wi-Fi connects.

steps.title: Troubleshoot Network Configuration
steps.rationale: If all else fails, network configuration might be the problem.
steps.action: Open Command Prompt as administrator and run the following commands: ipconfig /release, ipconfig /renew, netsh winsock reset. Restart your computer after running these commands.
steps.expect: Network configuration is reset, and Wi-Fi connects.

steps.title: Escalate
steps.rationale: If the issue persists after all steps, further assistance is needed.
steps.action: Contact your internet service provider or a qualified technician for advanced troubleshooting.
steps.expect: Issue is resolved by a professional.

quick_checks: Check for physical obstructions between laptop and router
diagnostics_to_collect: Event logs related to network connectivity
resolution_criteria: Successful connection to the Wi-Fi network
escalation_criteria: Unable to connect to Wi-Fi after trying all troubleshooting steps
safety_notes: Always back up important data before making significant system changes.
Be cautious when running commands in the Command Prompt.

queries.query: I can’t connect WiFi on my phone.

answer.issue_summary: Cannot connect to WiFi on a Windows laptop

steps.title: Quick Checks
steps.rationale: Rule out simple issues first
steps.action: Check if WiFi is enabled on the laptop and if the router is on and broadcasting the network.  Check for physical obstructions between the laptop and router.
steps.expect: WiFi is enabled, router is on, no obstructions

steps.title: Restart Laptop and Router
steps.rationale: Resets network connections and clears temporary glitches
steps.action: Restart your laptop. Unplug the router's power cord, wait 30 seconds, and plug it back in.
steps.expect: Laptop and router restart successfully

steps.title: Check WiFi Adapter Settings
steps.rationale: Ensure the WiFi adapter is correctly configured
steps.action: Go to Network and Sharing Center (search for it in the Start Menu). Click on "Change adapter options". Right-click on your WiFi adapter and select "Properties". Check if the adapter is enabled. Check the TCP/IP settings (IPv4 or IPv6) and ensure they are set to obtain an IP address automatically.
steps.expect: WiFi adapter is enabled and configured correctly

steps.title: Update or Reinstall WiFi Drivers
steps.rationale: Outdated or corrupted drivers can cause connectivity issues
steps.action: Go to Device Manager (search for it in the Start Menu). Expand "Network adapters". Right-click on your WiFi adapter and select "Update driver". If that fails, try uninstalling the driver and restarting the laptop. Windows will usually automatically reinstall the driver.
steps.expect: WiFi drivers are updated or reinstalled

steps.title: Troubleshoot Network Settings
steps.rationale: Check for incorrect network configurations
steps.action: Open Network and Sharing Center. Click on "Troubleshoot problems". Follow the on-screen instructions.
steps.expect: Network troubleshooter identifies and fixes issues

steps.title: Run Network Troubleshooter
steps.rationale: Windows built-in troubleshooter can detect and fix common network problems
steps.action: Search for "Network troubleshooter" in the Start Menu and run it. Follow the on-screen instructions.
steps.expect: Troubleshooter identifies and resolves the issue

steps.title: Check Router Settings
steps.rationale: Router misconfiguration can prevent connection
steps.action: Access your router's configuration page (usually by typing 192.168.1.1 or 192.168.0.1 in your browser). Check the WiFi settings, including the SSID and password. Ensure that the router's firmware is up-to-date.
steps.expect: Router settings are correct and firmware is up-to-date

steps.title: Escalate
steps.rationale: If all else fails, seek professional help
steps.action: Contact your internet service provider or a computer technician for further assistance.
steps.expect: Issue resolved by professional

quick_checks: Is WiFi enabled on the laptop?
Is the router on and broadcasting the network?
Are there any physical obstructions between the laptop and router?
resolution_criteria: Laptop successfully connects to WiFi network
escalation_criteria: Issue persists after all troubleshooting steps
safety_notes: Always back up important data before making significant system changes.
assumptions: Access to the internet (for driver updates)

queries.query: wifi is not working how to connect

answer.issue_summary: Wi-Fi not working on Windows laptop
plan_overview: Perform quick checks (Wi-Fi enabled, Airplane mode off)
Forget and reconnect to the Wi-Fi network

steps.title: Quick Checks
steps.rationale: Rule out simple issues before proceeding to more complex troubleshooting steps.
steps.action: Verify Wi-Fi is enabled and Airplane mode is disabled.
commands: Check the Wi-Fi icon in the system tray. Ensure it's enabled.
Go to Settings > Network & Internet > Airplane mode. Ensure it's turned off.
steps.expect: Wi-Fi is enabled and Airplane mode is off.

steps.title: Restart Modem and Router
steps.rationale: A restart often resolves temporary glitches in network devices.
steps.action: Power cycle the modem and router.
commands: Unplug the power cables of both the modem and router.
Plug the modem back in, wait for it to fully boot.
Plug the router back in, wait for it to fully boot.
steps.expect: Modem and router lights indicate they are online.

steps.title: Forget and Reconnect to Wi-Fi
steps.rationale: This can resolve issues with incorrect network settings.
steps.action: Remove the current Wi-Fi network profile and reconnect.
commands: Go to Settings > Network & Internet > Wi-Fi > Manage known networks.
Select your Wi-Fi network and click "Forget".
Reconnect to the network by entering the password.
steps.expect: Successful connection to the Wi-Fi network.

steps.title: Check and Update Wi-Fi Drivers
steps.rationale: Outdated or corrupted drivers can prevent Wi-Fi connectivity.
steps.action: Check for and install the latest Wi-Fi drivers.
commands: Open Device Manager (search for it in the Start Menu).
Right-click on your Wi-Fi adapter and select "Update driver".
steps.expect: Updated Wi-Fi drivers and successful connection.

steps.title: Check for ISP Outages
steps.rationale: Internet connectivity issues may stem from the ISP.
steps.action: Check the ISP's website or contact support for outages.
steps.expect: Confirmation of an outage or no outage reported.

steps.title: Escalate
steps.rationale: If all previous steps fail, further investigation is needed.
steps.action: Contact your ISP or a qualified technician for advanced troubleshooting.
steps.expect: Issue resolved by a professional.

quick_checks: Check if Wi-Fi is enabled on the laptop.
Check if Airplane mode is disabled.
diagnostics_to_collect: Details of Wi-Fi adapter (from Device Manager)
escalation_criteria: All troubleshooting steps have been exhausted without success.
safety_notes: Always back up important data before making significant system changes.
Avoid opening suspicious links or attachments.
assumptions: The user has administrative privileges on their laptop.
The user has the correct Wi-Fi password.
